Basic implementation

It's recommanded to set the popin in a new entry of target node. So you can access options and function 

document.querySelector('.js-popin').popin = new Popin(element)

The HTML: 

<div class="Popin js-popin" data-popin="popin1" tabindex="-1" aria-hidden="1">
    <div class="Popin-main js-popin-main">
        <button class="CloseBtn Popin-close js-popin-close" data-popin-close="popin1">
            Close
        </button>
        <div class="Popin-content js-popin-content is-rtf">
            contenu de la popin
        </div>
    </div>
</div>
contenu de la popin

Custom markup

You can change the markup, and selector so, but you have to keep some data-attributes and the HTML structure

data-popin="{popinId}" on main container
data-popin-open="{popinId}" on the open button/link
data-popin-close="{popinId}" on the close button/link

Available changes for selectors:

selectors: {
    btnOpen: '.js-popin-open',
    btnClose: '.js-popin-close',
    popinMain: '.js-popin-main',
    popinContent: '.js-popin-content'
}

Contenu de la popin

Loading external content: json

Load option can be override in html with the data attribute data-popin-load

element.popin = new Popin(element, {
    load: 'https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/posts/1',
    loadType: 'json',
    loadSelector: 'body',
})

You can also load HTML content by setting loadType: 'html' options and use the loadSelector options like a querySelector.

Contenu de la popin

This popin is open by default

When you close it, it open an other popin because of the openThen option.
